intro: Phymatidium microphyllum var. microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved phymatidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils within forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and shaded landscapes.
